definition: non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])

sentences.english: The blind alley ended in a brick wall.
sentences.chinese: 这条死胡同的尽头是砖墙。

sentences.english: As a member of the dead-end youth.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个死胡同青年成员。

sentences.english: Huodataidu on porphyrin As for the Horn into a blind alley or.
sentences.chinese: 豁达大度，就卟至于转入死胡同或牛角尖。

sentences.english: Then they explored administrative appeal avenues, which turned out to be a dead end.
sentences.chinese: 后来他们采取行政诉讼的途径，但也是一条死胡同。

sentences.english: Don't drive in. This is a dead end.
sentences.chinese: 不要开进去，这是个死胡同。

sentences.english: I'll answer for it that he is in the blind alley.
sentences.chinese: 我准保他在这死胡同里。

sentences.english: They faced a dead end, terminating in a small shop selling wicker baskets.
sentences.chinese: 死胡同，尽头是一个卖柳条筐的小商店。

sentences.english: There is no good way out of the corner into which China has painted itself.
sentences.chinese: 要走出中国自己钻入的死胡同没有什么好办法。

sentences.english: Fashion that is just about merchandise always feels like a dead end.
sentences.chinese: 几乎仅仅是商品的时装，总感觉像是一个死胡同。

sentences.english: The cul-de-sac stasis of life in the suburban middle class?
sentences.chinese: 是郊区中产阶级生活的静止的死胡同？

sentences.english: Initial attempts lead to dead-ends yor a return to the starting point.
sentences.chinese: 最初的尝试导致他们进入了死胡同，或者返回到起点。

definition: dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course
pinyin: yi1 tiao2 dao4 zou3 dao4 hei1

definition: to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
this road is blocked/fig. This method does not work./Doing this is no good.
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
a way out (lit. and fig.)/opportunity for advancement/a way forward/outlet (for one's products)
